recipes.name: Prawn Curry
recipes.instructions: Cook onions with spices, add tomatoes and pasata, simmer, then stir in yogurt and cream. Garnish with fresh coriander.

recipes.name: Roasted Buttermint Squash
recipes.instructions: Roast squash until tender. Serve with labneh, figs, and a sprinkle of za'atar.

recipes.name: Chestnut Sauce
recipes.instructions: Roast chestnuts in butter, add shallots, boil both milks, infuse thyme, reduce with Martini.

recipes.name: Cajun Seafood Boil with Garlic Butter Sauce

items: 1/2 - 3/4 cup Cajun or Old Bay Seasoning
1.5 lbs small red or Yukon Gold potatoes, halved
12-14 oz smoked Andouille sausage, 1-2 inch pieces
4-6 ears of corn on the cob, halved or quartered

instructions.description: Combine liquid (water/beer/stock), onion, garlic, lemon slices, bay leaves, Cajun/Old Bay seasoning, and salt in a large stockpot. Bring to a rolling boil and cook for 10-15 minutes to develop flavor.
Add the **potatoes**. Boil for 10-15 minutes until almost tender. Then, add the **sausage and corn** and boil for another 3-5 minutes.

Add the **crab legs** and **shrimp** (and any other seafood). Immediately turn off the heat, cover the pot, and let the seafood soak for 3-10 minutes. Shrimp is done when pink and curved into a 'C' shape.
While soaking, make the sauce: Melt butter, sauté minced garlic for 2-3 minutes. Stir in Cajun/Creole seasoning, Old Bay, paprika, lemon juice, and optional reserved broth. Stir in parsley.
Drain all the seafood and vegetables. Pour onto a large platter or newspaper-lined table. Generously pour the garlic butter sauce over everything and serve immediately.
